snippet: Most countries treat the biennial games as something of a good-will exchange for amateur athletes, but not the Russians, who fielded a star-studded team stacked with 18 gold-medal winners from the real Olympics.
abstract: Most countries treat biennial World University Games as something of a good-will exchange for amateur athletes, but 2013 host country Russia fielded a star-studded team stacked with 18 gold-medal winners from the real Olympics.
lead_paragraph: Most countries treat the biennial games as something of a good-will exchange for amateur athletes, but not the Russians, who fielded a star-studded team stacked with 18 gold-medal winners from the real Olympics.

headline.main: Russia Stacked Team With Stars for World University Games
headline.print_headline: Russia Team Was Stacked With Stars
